title: How to Use the Sum Function in Microsoft Excel

steps.title: Decide what column of numbers or words you would like to add up.
steps.content: Decide what column of numbers or words you would like to add up. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Select the cell where you'd like the answer to populate.
steps.content: Select the cell where you'd like the answer to populate. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Type the equals sign then SUM.
steps.content: Type the equals sign then SUM. Like this: =SUM. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Type out the first cell reference, then a colon, then the last cell reference.
steps.content: Type out the first cell reference, then a colon, then the last cell reference. Like this: =Sum(A2:A4). [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Press enter.
steps.content: Press enter. Excel will add up the numbers in cells A2 to A4.

steps.title: To add a complete column or row of numbers, use AutoSum.
steps.content: To add a complete column or row of numbers, use AutoSum. Click into the cell at the end of the list you want to add (below or next to the given numbers). [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source In Windows, press Alt and = at the same time. On a Mac, press Command and Shift and T at the same time. Or on any computer, you can select the Autosum button from the Excel menu/ribbon.

steps.title: Confirm that the highlighted cells are the ones you want to add up.
steps.content: Confirm that the highlighted cells are the ones you want to add up. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Place your mouse pointer to the bottom right of the cell you just finished adding up, to add up multiple columns.
steps.content: Place your mouse pointer to the bottom right of the cell you just finished adding up, to add up multiple columns. The pointer will turn into a thick black cross.

steps.title: Hold down your left mouse button.
steps.content: Hold down your left mouse button. Keep it held down as you drag it across all of the cells you wish to add. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Move your mouse pointer over the last cell, then let go of the button.
steps.content: Move your mouse pointer over the last cell, then let go of the button. Excel will AutoFill the rest of the formulas for you!
